title: How to Make Pizza Pockets

methods.name: Making Turkey Sausage Pockets with Pizza Dough

steps.headline: Fry your sausage and arugula.
steps.description: Coat the bottom of a medium-sized skillet with the olive oil. Set your stovetop's burner to medium heat. Once the oil heats up, place the sausage in the skillet and cook for roughly 5 minutes, or until it starts to crumble and turn golden. Then place the arugula in with it and continue to cook until the greens wilt.

steps.headline: Make your filling.
steps.description: Once the sausage and arugula have cooked, switch off the heat. Give them approximately 10 minutes to cool off. Once they have, stir in your cream cheese, salt, pepper, and ⅓ cup of your Parmesan until they're even mixed.

steps.headline: Prepare your dough.
steps.description: First, set your oven to 400 degrees Fahrenheit (204 degrees Celsius). While that preheats, dust a surface with flour. Roll your dough out until it thins out to a rectangle that's roughly 12 x 20 inches (30.5 x 51 cm). Use a knife or pizza cutter to slice it in half lengthwise. Then slice each half into 8 rectangles of equal size, for a total of 16.

steps.headline: Form your pockets.
steps.description: First, beat your egg in a small bowl. Then top each rectangle with your filling and brush their edges with the egg. Fold them in half, then use a fork to seal and crease the dough where its edges meet. Brush their tops with more egg.

steps.headline: Bake your pockets.
steps.description: Line a baking sheet with parchment paper. Transfer your pockets to the sheet. Dust the tops with the extra Parmesan. Place them in the oven and bake for roughly 15 to 17 minutes, or until they turn golden.

methods.name: Using Pepperoni & Mushroom Pockets with Pastry Puff

steps.headline: Prepare your dough.
steps.description: Dust a surface with flour. Use a rolling pin to roll each sheet of pastry puff into a square that's roughly 12 x 12 inches (30.5 x 30.5 cm). Take a knife or pizza cutter and divide each square into nine smaller squares of equal size.

steps.headline: Add your filling.
steps.description: First, dice up your pepperoni slices and mushrooms. Put those in a large mixing bowl and add your mozzarella and a ½ teaspoon of Italian seasonings. Stir them up until they're evenly mixed. Place equal amounts of filling on each pastry square. Use your spoon to drag the filling diagonally from one corner to its opposite.

steps.headline: Seal your pockets.
steps.description: Brush water over the edges of each square. Fold them in half diagonally, with the spread-out filling along each one's crease, so they look like triangles. Pinch the wet edges together where they meet to seal each pocket.

steps.headline: Brush them with egg wash. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper and set your triangles on that.
steps.description: Then, in a small bowl, crack and whisk your eggs along with 2 tablespoons (29.6 ml) of water. Take a pastry brush and cover each triangle with the egg wash. Then dust them with the remaining Italian seasonings.

steps.headline: Bake your pockets.
steps.description: Set your oven to 400 degrees Fahrenheit (204 degrees Celsius). While that heats up, place your baking sheets in the refrigerator to keep the pastry chilled in the meantime. Once the oven's ready, transfer the baking sheets and cook for about 15 to 18 minutes, or until the pastry turns a golden color.

steps.headline: Prep your veggies and herb.
steps.description: Dice your onion. Mince your garlic. Slice or tear your basil leaves up into shreds. Do this before you put your pockets in the oven to bake. Your sauce should take about as much time to cook as your pockets will to bake and then cool off enough to safely handle.

steps.headline: Saute your onion, garlic, and paste.
steps.description: Line the bottom of a large saucepan with olive oil. Set the burner to medium-low. Once the oil heats up, add the onions and saute for two to three minutes, or until they turn translucent. Add the garlic, wait one minute, then stir in your tomato paste and saute for one more minute.

steps.headline: Add the rest and simmer.
steps.description: Pour in your diced tomatoes. Stir in the sugar and basil. Add salt and pepper as desired. Place your pockets in the oven at this point, and let the sauce simmer for 15 minutes, stirring occasionally (or longer, if the pockets need more time). If desired, use an immersion blender to smooth the sauce out.

text: Making Turkey Sausage Pockets with Pizza Dough Fry your sausage and arugula. Coat the bottom of a medium-sized skillet with the olive oil. Set your stovetop's burner to medium heat. Once the oil heats up, place the sausage in the skillet and cook for roughly 5 minutes, or until it starts to crumble and turn golden. Then place the arugula in with it and continue to cook until the greens wilt. Make your filling. Once the sausage and arugula have cooked, switch off the heat. Give them approximately 10 minutes to cool off. Once they have, stir in your cream cheese, salt, pepper, and ⅓ cup of your Parmesan until they're even mixed. Prepare your dough. First, set your oven to 400 degrees Fahrenheit (204 degrees Celsius). While that preheats, dust a surface with flour. Roll your dough out until it thins out to a rectangle that's roughly 12 x 20 inches (30.5 x 51 cm). Use a knife or pizza cutter to slice it in half lengthwise. Then slice each half into 8 rectangles of equal size, for a total of 16. Form your pockets. First, beat your egg in a small bowl. Then top each rectangle with your filling and brush their edges with the egg. Fold them in half, then use a fork to seal and crease the dough where its edges meet. Brush their tops with more egg. Bake your pockets. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper. Transfer your pockets to the sheet. Dust the tops with the extra Parmesan. Place them in the oven and bake for roughly 15 to 17 minutes, or until they turn golden. Using Pepperoni & Mushroom Pockets with Pastry Puff Prepare your dough. Dust a surface with flour. Use a rolling pin to roll each sheet of pastry puff into a square that's roughly 12 x 12 inches (30.5 x 30.5 cm). Take a knife or pizza cutter and divide each square into nine smaller squares of equal size. Add your filling. First, dice up your pepperoni slices and mushrooms. Put those in a large mixing bowl and add your mozzarella and a ½ teaspoon of Italian seasonings. Stir them up until they're evenly mixed. Place equal amounts of filling on each pastry square. Use your spoon to drag the filling diagonally from one corner to its opposite. Seal your pockets. Brush water over the edges of each square. Fold them in half diagonally, with the spread-out filling along each one's crease, so they look like triangles. Pinch the wet edges together where they meet to seal each pocket. Brush them with egg wash. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper and set your triangles on that. Then, in a small bowl, crack and whisk your eggs along with 2 tablespoons (29.6 ml) of water. Take a pastry brush and cover each triangle with the egg wash. Then dust them with the remaining Italian seasonings. Bake your pockets. Set your oven to 400 degrees Fahrenheit (204 degrees Celsius). While that heats up, place your baking sheets in the refrigerator to keep the pastry chilled in the meantime. Once the oven's ready, transfer the baking sheets and cook for about 15 to 18 minutes, or until the pastry turns a golden color. Making Dipping Sauce Prep your veggies and herb. Dice your onion. Mince your garlic. Slice or tear your basil leaves up into shreds. Do this before you put your pockets in the oven to bake. Your sauce should take about as much time to cook as your pockets will to bake and then cool off enough to safely handle. Saute your onion, garlic, and paste. Line the bottom of a large saucepan with olive oil. Set the burner to medium-low. Once the oil heats up, add the onions and saute for two to three minutes, or until they turn translucent. Add the garlic, wait one minute, then stir in your tomato paste and saute for one more minute. Add the rest and simmer. Pour in your diced tomatoes. Stir in the sugar and basil. Add salt and pepper as desired. Place your pockets in the oven at this point, and let the sauce simmer for 15 minutes, stirring occasionally (or longer, if the pockets need more time). If desired, use an immersion blender to smooth the sauce out.
